snippet: The average boat passenger weighs 25 pounds more than in years past, so boat capacities need to be reconsidered, the Coast Guard says.
abstract: Coast Guard formally puts into effect rules requiring certain passenger vessels to comply with its new Assumed Average Weight per Person, which estimates average boat passenger to be 25 pounds heavier than in years past; regulation may mean reduced revenue for vessels that are now allowed to carry fewer passengers per day.
lead_paragraph: The average boat passenger weighs 25 pounds more than in years past, so boat capacities need to be reconsidered, the Coast Guard says.

headline.seo: Coast Guard Raises Assumed Average Weight per Person
headline.main: Bulk’s Not Just in Bulkhead, So Coast Guard Steps In
headline.print_headline: Bulk’s Not Just in Bulkhead, So the Coast Guard Steps In
